name: Chapati
history: Chapati, also known as roti, is a traditional Indian flatbread. It's a staple in many parts of India and is known for its simplicity, made with just flour and water. Chapati has been a part of Indian cuisine for centuries.
description: Chapati is a thin, unleavened flatbread made from whole wheat flour. It is cooked on a hot griddle and often served with various curries, dals, and vegetables. Chapati is appreciated for its light, soft texture and wholesome taste.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: Mix whole wheat flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead to form a soft, pliable dough. Let it rest for 15 minutes.

instructions.title: Roll and Cook the Chapatis
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin, flat circle. Cook each chapati on a hot griddle, flipping once one side is cooked and small bubbles appear on the other side. Optionally, brush with oil or ghee.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the hot chapatis with curries, dals, or any other side dish.

tips: The dough should be soft and non-sticky for the best results.
Press gently while cooking to ensure even browning.
variations: Add herbs or spices like cumin seeds to the dough for added flavor.
Stuff with vegetables or lentils to make stuffed chapatis.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Reheat on a griddle before serving if stored.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on a hot griddle or tawa until warm and soft.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional roti basket lined with a cloth.
Pair with a variety of dips and side dishes for a complete meal.
